Package de.hdm_stuttgart.mi.se1.project

Class Converter

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.hdm_stuttgart.mi.se1.project.Converter

  • public class Converter
extends java.lang.Object
    The class for converting strings to double values or converting strings that can cause exception troubles into strings that are less troubling

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private static boolean positive
      boolean that tracks if the number is positive or not
      private static boolean positiveExponent
      boolean that tracks if the exponential number behind the exponentialLiteral "E" is positive

    • Method Detail

      • convertLiterals

        public static double convertLiterals​(java.lang.String undefinedNumber)
                              throws ExceptionCluster
        Parameters:
        undefinedNumber - parses the undefinedNumber and builds up a double value by decimal places
        Returns:
        undefinedNumber converted to double
        Throws:
        ExceptionCluster - throws exception if pi or e Literal are used wrong or a NumberStructureException occurs

      • splitSafe

        public static java.lang.String[] splitSafe​(java.lang.String insecureString)
                                    throws ExceptionCluster
        a method used to remove all blanks in the input that are placed, which could cause troubles in case they get recognized as a number and then converted into the number 0. Also uses the alertQuit to check if the is the word "quit" in the input at any point.
        Parameters:
        insecureString - Removing all blanks
        Returns:
        secureInput changed into an String[] after being checked by alertQuit
        Throws:
        ExceptionCluster - EmptyEntryException thrown by splitSafe when the entry was empty or filled with blanks. Throws the FoundQuitException of splitSafe.

      • alertQuit

        private static void alertQuit​(java.lang.String secureInputString)
                       throws FoundQuitException
        Looking for the word "quit" in the secureInputString and triggers an exception when it is found.
        Parameters:
        secureInputString - Looking for the word "quit" in the parameter
        Throws:
        FoundQuitException - When this exception is thrown the program will start a request if he really wants to quit.

      • checkIfIndexIs

        private static boolean checkIfIndexIs​(int index,
                                      char character,
                                      java.lang.String undefinedNumber)
        Helper method used to check two characters in sequence no matter if the second character index is outside of the String
        Parameters:
        index - The index that needs to be checked
        character - The character that is looked for at the indices
        undefinedNumber - String in which the character is looked for
        Returns:
        Boolean which tells if at the character is found at a specific index true when it is the character and false when it was not found or the index is out of range of the given string

      • isHexaDecimalNumber

        private static boolean isHexaDecimalNumber​(boolean zeroIsZero,
                                           boolean oneIsZero,
                                           boolean oneIsx,
                                           boolean twoIsx,
                                           boolean oneIsX,
                                           boolean twoIsX)
        checks if an object with certain starting digits is a hexadecimal number
        Parameters:
        zeroIsZero - boolean that tells if 0 is the Value at Index 0
        oneIsZero - boolean that tells if 0 is the Value at Index 1
        oneIsx - boolean that tells if 0 is the Value at Index 1
        twoIsx - boolean that tells if 0 is the Value at Index 2
        oneIsX - boolean that tells if 0 is the Value at Index 1
        twoIsX - boolean that tells if 0 is the Value at Index 2
        Returns:
        true If a String with those boolean values fulfils a certain condition. Either it has to be the first 2 letters are 0X / 0x or the second and third letters are 0x / 0X

      • isBinaryNumber

        private static boolean isBinaryNumber​(boolean zeroIsZero,
                                      boolean oneIsZero,
                                      boolean oneIsB,
                                      boolean twoIsB,
                                      boolean oneIsb,
                                      boolean twoIsb)
        checks if an object with certain starting digits is a binary number
        Parameters:
        zeroIsZero - boolean that tells if 0 is the Value at Index 0
        oneIsZero - boolean that tells if 0 is the Value at Index 1
        oneIsB - boolean that tells if 0 is the Value at Index 1
        twoIsB - boolean that tells if 0 is the Value at Index 2
        oneIsb - boolean that tells if 0 is the Value at Index 1
        twoIsb - boolean that tells if 0 is the Value at Index 2
        Returns:
        true If a String with those boolean values fulfils a certain condition. Either it has to be the first 2 letters are 0B / 0b or the second and third letters are 0B / 0b

      • calculateDecimalNumber

        private static double calculateDecimalNumber​(int decimalLiteralIndex,
                                             int exponentialLiteralIndex,
                                             java.lang.String undefinedNumber)
                                      throws ExceptionCluster
        The method builds up a double value depending on the indices, it builds up the number in this way : a*10^1+b*10^0,c*10^-1 end of number or exponentialLiteralIndex = ab,c
        Parameters:
        decimalLiteralIndex - The Index that is used to build up the decimal number in the decimal base logic. a*10^1+b*10^0,c*10^-1 = ab,c
        exponentialLiteralIndex - The Index is needed to see when the decimal number ends. If there is no exponential index the string is evaluated as a decimal number until the last index.
        undefinedNumber - undefinedNumber is a string that gets converted into a decimal number.
        Returns:
        numberValue the value of the decimal number as a double value.
        Throws:
        LiteralAbuseException - throws LiteralAbuseException when 'pi' or 'e' are written within a number.
        NumberStructureException - Throws NumberStructureException when something has been appended into errorCalls, because of a digit that couldn't be recognized or was set at the wrong point.
        ExceptionCluster

      • calculateBinaryNumber

        private static double calculateBinaryNumber​(int exponentialLiteralIndex,
                                            java.lang.String undefinedNumber)
                                     throws NumberStructureException
        The method builds up a double value depending on the indices, it builds up the number in this way : a*2^x...b*2^2+c*2^1+d*2^0
        Parameters:
        exponentialLiteralIndex - The Index that is used to build up the decimal number in the decimal base logic. a*2^1+b*2^0,c*2^-1 = ab,c
        undefinedNumber - undefinedNumber is a string that gets converted into a decimal number
        Returns:
        numberValue the value of the binary number as a double value.
        Throws:
        NumberStructureException - Throws NumberStructureException when something has been appended into errorCalls, because of a digit that couldn't be recognized or was set at the wrong point.

      • calculateHexadecimalNumber

        private static double calculateHexadecimalNumber​(java.lang.String undefinedNumber)
                                          throws NumberStructureException
        The method builds up a double value depending on the indices, it builds up the number in this way : a*16^x...b*16^2+c*16^1+d*16^0
        Parameters:
        undefinedNumber - undefinedNumber is a string that gets converted into a hexadecimal number
        Returns:
        numberValue the value of the hexadecimal number as a double value.
        Throws:
        NumberStructureException - Throws NumberStructureException when something has been appended into errorCalls, because of a digit that couldn't be recognized or was set at the wrong point.

      • calculateExponentialNumber

        private static double calculateExponentialNumber​(int exponentialLiteralIndex,
                                                 java.lang.String undefinedNumber)
        The method builds up a double value depending on the indices, it builds up the number in this way : a*10^1+b*10^0,c*10^-1 end of number or exponentialLiteralIndex = ab,c
        Parameters:
        exponentialLiteralIndex - is the index from where this method starts to evaluate the undefinedNumber and analyzes until the end of undefinedNumber.
        undefinedNumber - undefinedNumber is a string that gets converted into an exponential number.
        Returns:
        exponentialNumber the value of the decimal number as a double value.
        Throws:
        LiteralAbuseException - throws LiteralAbuseException when 'pi' or 'e' are written within a number.
        NumberStructureException - Throws NumberStructureException when something has been appended into errorCalls, because of a digit that couldn't be recognized or was set at the wrong point.
